title: Easy Methods to Reset Your Samsung Refrigerator

steps.title: Samsung doesn't recommend resetting your refrigerator as a first troubleshooting step.
steps.content: Samsung doesn't recommend resetting your refrigerator as a first troubleshooting step. You might see something weird on your display and automatically think to reset it. But don't! Resetting will delete the error code history, which means that a support technician won't be able to properly troubleshoot the issue if a reset doesn't fix it. [1] X Research source Instead, request service so a Samsung technician can diagnose the error codes. The issue could be a simple fix, such as a water filter you need to replace. The code displayed on your fridge door should help you diagnose the issue . After you fix the error code (like an old water filter), the code will disappear. If your ice maker is the issue, defrosting it is super easy!

steps.title: Reset when you see the "88 88" error code.
steps.content: Reset when you see the "88 88" error code. This code usually occurs after an outage, as it tends to indicate that the fridge didn't boot properly. Reset your refrigerator to reboot and fix the error. Check out this list of Samsung refrigerator error codes for more information about your refrigerator's issues: https://www.samsung.com/us/support/troubleshooting/TSG01003409/

steps.title: Reset your refrigerator when you clean or move it.
steps.content: Reset your refrigerator when you clean or move it. Samsung recommends this being one of the few times you reset your fridge, as it'll be in good working order at the time and not have any error codes that are important to keep.

steps.title: Don't reset your fridge if you see an "O FF" code (also seen as "OFF OFF" or "OF OF").
steps.content: Don't reset your fridge if you see an "O FF" code (also seen as "OFF OFF" or "OF OF"). This code means that your refrigerator is in Demo mode (also known as Cooling Off Mode) and doesn't need a restart to fix. The steps for this vary depending on the kind of screen you have: If you have Family Hub, go to Apps > Fridge Manager > Fridge Settings > Cooling Off > Deactivate . Other models require pressing a certain button combination, such as pressing and holding the top two buttons on the left panel for 10 seconds. To find out how to turn off Demo or Cooling Off mode for your model, check your manual. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Unplug your fridge from the wall.
steps.content: Unplug your fridge from the wall. You can also turn off the power at the circuit breaker if you can't get to the plug. This is perhaps the easiest and best way to reset your Samsung fridge, so try this method first to resolve any troubleshooting issues. This is also recommended for resolving an "88 88" error.

steps.title: Wait about 5 minutes.
steps.content: Wait about 5 minutes. You want to make sure that any residual electric charge is gone before you continue to the next step.

steps.title: Plug it back in.
steps.content: Plug it back in. If you turned off the power at the circuit breaker, you can flip the switch to turn the power back on. [3] X Research source If you need to reset your Family Hub screen, flip the red switch that's located on the top of the inside of the right door. [4] X Research source Turn it off, wait 15 seconds, and turn it back on.

steps.title: Navigate to Settings.
steps.content: Navigate to Settings. If you want to sell or give away your refrigerator with Family Hub, you should perform a factory reset before you do so. If you just need to reset the screen, flip the red switch that's located on the top of the inside of the right door.

steps.title: Select About Family Hub.
steps.content: Select About Family Hub . The exact location of this in the menu varies depending on the year model for your fridge.

steps.title: Select Factory data reset and tap Reset.
steps.content: Select Factory data reset and tap Reset . Since resetting this also deletes all your data, Samsung wants to make sure that you're aware of what you're trying to do. Select Reset again when prompted, then tap Delete all data to factory reset your Family Hub.
